data column names corresponding to case samples
data column names corresponding to control samples
directories that hold case and control data for this library
grep terms to search for in input_dirs
peptide or protein, corresponding to data_types. Affect annotation.
Minimum number of hits based on hit_thresh required to compute case_rcp for that peptide or protein.
Threshold for considering data hit.
RCP threshold for statistics and clustergram binarization.
Statistical test to perform (currently only supports Fisher).
Pvalue correction method to be fed to p.adjust.
Hit subsetting limit for minimum sample hits for inclusion of a peptide/protein.
Hit subsetting limit for minimum sample RCP hits for inclusion of a peptide/protein.
Hit subsetting limit for minimum frequency of sample RCP hits for inclusion of a peptide/protein.
Hit subsetting limit for maximum pvalue
path to library annotation file
For data_level=="peptide", the name of a column in annot that corresponds to the first column of data.
For data_level=="protein", the name of a column in annot that corresponds to the first column of data.
For data_level=="peptide", the name of a column in annot that corresponds to identifiers to display in the markdown report corresponding to each peptide.
The name of a column in annot that corresponds to identifiers to display in the markdown report corresponding to each protein.
The name of a column in annot that corresponds to identifiers to display in the markdown report corresponding to gene product or similar short protein descriptions to display in the markdown report.
Character string or vector of column  name(s) corresponding to annotation flags to indicate in the markdown report (e.g. of known autoantigens or surface proteins).
"binary" to detect whether or not there is text in that cell. "literal" to display exact text from cell.
Character string of column name in annot corresponding to peptide amino acid sequence in the markdown report. Needed for epitopefindr.
Logical controlling whether or not clustergram will be binarized above/below rcp_thresh.
Field delimiter in sample names (column names of case_rcp.)
Which field(s) to retrain from sample names when separated by sample_field delimiter.
Logical, whether or not to generate AVARDA targets.

Filename substring for AVARDA seropositivitity matrix.
